questions.question: A traveling companion of Paul, and the author of NT works including one of the Gospels and Acts.
Though Jesus' native tongue was Aramaic, the NT accounts of him were written in this language.

questions.question: These five books of the Bible were written by Moses.
The author of the book of Hebrews.
The idea that Scripture is not able to lead us astray in matters of faith and practice
Confidence, trust, or dependence based on reason
The primary title for the Roman emperor also used by the New Testament authors to describe Jesus Christ.
The doctrine that Scripture in the original manuscripts doesn’t affirm anything contrary to fact
The doctrine that Christ was both fully man and fully God.
This OT prophet heard God’s voice as a young boy while serving under Eli, and later anointed Israel’s first king, Saul

This group of people were religious purists committed to preserving and obeying the law meticulously.  They were orthodox in their beliefs, which included immortality, resurrection, angels, and demons.
This group was the Jewish ruling council during New Testament times
This group of people denied the resurrection of the dead, the immortality of the soul, and accepted only the first 5 books of the OT. They were comprised of only the rich.
These men were the half-brothers of Jesus.
This worldview holds that there is no Objective Truth.
The belief that the world and God are identical.
The naturalistic view of knowledge that holds that "science is the measure of all things, of what is that it is, and of what is not that it is not."
This Abrahamic, monotheistic religion believes that there is only one God, and that Muhammad is a messenger of God.

The teaching that life is permeated with suffering caused by desire, that suffering ceases when desire ceases, and that enlightenment obtained through right conduct and wisdom and meditation releases one from desire and suffering and rebirth.
He's the protagonist in the classic RPG "The Legend of Zelda."
This video game character is blue, collects rings, and goes really fast.
This mustachioed plumber is tasked with saving the princess of the Mushroom Kingdom.
This simple but popular video game is often mistakenly considered the first video game due to its close resemblence of the original.
This fighting game inspired the modern rating system due to its graphic violence.

final-jeopardy.question: Which of the following was authored by one who is recognized as an apostle? Acts, Mark, Luke, Romans, Hebrews, or Jude

questions.question: This OT Book describes Israel’s deliverance from Egypt, the constitution of the people of Israel through covenant law, and instructions for the tabernacle – the place of God’s presence.

One of these men was NOT one of the original 12 disciples. James, Mark, Nathanael, or Thaddaeus
God's goodness toward those who deserve only punishment.
The doctrine that God eternally exists as three persons - Father, Son, and Holy Spirit - and each person is fully God, and there is one God.
A term referring to the fact that the words of Scripture are spoken by God, or "God-breathed."
The branch of Christian theology which seeks to provide a rational justification for the truth claims of the Christian faith.
The process of interpreting a text of Scripture for its application in today’s culture.
This person led the Israelites out of Egypt.
Before changing his name, Paul went by this name.
This NT figure fortold of the coming Christ and later baptized Christ.
This OT figure was tested by being told by God to sacrifice his promised son.

This worldview holds that the physical universe is all that exists.
